fields.summary: Errors clicking on Greenhopper links

fields.description:
I don't remember exactly what portlet I had on this dashboard, but since the upgrade it is broken. Please check. It's on jira.atlassian.com. My dashboard called test renders as "WARNING: $portletConfig.key 
Portlets of this type have been disabled or removed from the system. "
fields.summary: Portlet unavailable

fields.description:
When exporting more than 1000 issues to Excel, JIRA only exports 1000 issues. A solution to address this issue (for XML) is described in JRA-8214.

I looked at the latest documentation (http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.5/navigatorviews.html) and noticed that the tempMax parameter is mentioned under XML, but not under Excel. I believe the documentation should be updated to include this information under Excel as well. Also since not all JIRA users have admin access, mentioning the workaround of changing the tempMax parameter value in the URL would be useful.
fields.summary: Excel Export / tempMax / Documentation

fields.description:
This is observed from the jira.attlassian.com 4.0 beta 2 release:

When you minimize a "Project Statistics" portlet, you can not tell what is inside the Portlet.

From screen shot example:  The Portlet that is minimized shows stats on "Project: Crowd", however there is no way to tell this by looking at it.
- Should minimized portlets act like minimized taskbar items, include the file open in the writeup?

Not shown in the screenshot:

When you change the Background Color to White and minimize the area it appears to disappear.  This is because the text is white by default and there is no box around it.
Solution Options
- Do not let the background be the same color as the text (browser overrides of CSS considerations would have to be excluded from this)
- Let user set font color in quick drop down for that box
fields.summary: "Project Statistics" Gadget Border issues

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. From issues drop down select some filter or run some search.
3. In issue navigator for any issue select "Add comment" from actions drop down.

Result:
1. The user is taken to "Add comment" dialog but focus is no where.
2. This issue is not on IE(surprise)

Expected:
1. It will be great if focus can be on comment field and user can start typing without bothering the position of cursor.
2. If I click "Add comment" from open issue, the add comment dialog which user get has right focus.
fields.summary: Selecting comment from issue actions drop down doesn't set focus on "comment" field.
Drop down menu doesn't work on "Create Issue" screen
It is annoying trying to access most frequently used filters in JIRA 4.0 when you have more than 10
Multiple email subscriptions will be sent from the first users locale
JQL Upgrade Task incorrectly converts search request with "released versions" selected for Version field

fields.description:
At the moment if you paste a string inside of quotes in the JQL input and that contains newlines when you submit the parser will tell you to replace the newlines with \n\t

Instead we should accept those values just as they were entered, there is no reason to make the users go through the trouble of changing that pasted string.
fields.summary: Lets try to fix the parser so that we allow newlines and returns should be allowed inside of strings

fields.description: Document the JQL builder interface.
fields.summary: Javadoc the JQL Query Builder

fields.description:
Lets change the resolution field to look for the special case unresolved so users can type resoltion = unresolved

We will need to just hack this in. If users have a real unresolved resolution then lets just run the query for both. They can always really get Unresolved by saying resolution is empty.

We need to change the Resolution name resolver, change the SearchInputTransformer to generate the query resolution = unresolved, and change the autocomplete values generator to handle this value.
fields.summary: Lets change the resolution field to look for the special case unresolved so users can type resoltion = unresolved

fields.description:
I have the "Assigned to me" gadget in my dashboard which is a migration of the portlet from 3.x 

If I click the link at the top of the gadget to this link:

http://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&resolution=-1&sorter/field=created&sorter/order=ASC&sorter/field=priority&sorter/order=DESC

I get a 404 page from tomcat.

Will there be a nice 404 page at some time?
fields.summary: The "Assigned to me gadget has a link which gives a 404

fields.description:
When trying to switch to simple and the query is too complex you get the message
 'Query is too complex to display in the Issue Navigator edit controls' 

This should be changed to "Query is too complex to display in Simple mode"
fields.summary: The error message 'Query is too complex to display in the Issue Navigator edit controls' should be changed to "Query is too complex to display in Simple mode"

fields.description: The history links in the advanced issue navigator should contain an href such that if they are middle clicked that they will open that search in a new tab.
fields.summary: JQL History links should be middle clickable

fields.description:
From GreenHopper's Charboard page, clicking on the Views/Excel(chart data) link results in an NPE. This is a headache for the dev teams using the Sprint Candy build monitor, because it uses this URL to get sprint data. The affected teams are FishEye, Clover, Crucible, Bamboo, JIRA(?) 

!http://img.skitch.com/20090806-j9y1rd7d9a6x6k2ddqiuhi95g1.jpg!

Resulting NPE:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.charts.timetracking.HourBurndown.getHeader(HourBurndown.java:321)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.charts.timetracking.HourBurndown.getCSVFile(HourBurndown.java:163)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.boards.ChartBoard.getChartReport(ChartBoard.java:181)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.ChartReportAction.doShowChartReport(ChartReportAction.java:22)

	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.invokeCommand(ActionSupport.java:417)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:64)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:141)

fields.summary: GreenHopper's CSV export results in NPE on JAC

fields.description: Create Issue dialog contains dupes when scheme contains subtasks
fields.summary: Create Issue dialog contains dupes when scheme contains subtasks

fields.description:
Just tried uploading the following file:

https://maven.atlassian.com/private-snapshot/com/atlassian/crowd/crowd-core/2.0.1-SNAPSHOT/crowd-core-2.0.1-20090805.075007-85.jar

To a JIRA issue in the Crowd project and it just wouldn't complete, it worked fine in firefox. Changing the User-Agent in Safari didn't provide any success either.

Jus
fields.summary: Uploading a JAR file failing using Safari 4.0.2

fields.description:
The upgrade task looks at the wrong database column for the author of the search request. Subsequently, it encounters nulls where it thought it wouldn't.

We need to get the right data, and also handle nulls in the bizarre case that the author of a SearchRequest is null.
fields.summary: JQL Upgrade Task throws NullPointerException

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Access the drop down options in Issues link.
3. The drop down has one option "Create filter"
4. Click on that option.

Result:
1. It take user to the screen for creating new search.
2. Option create filter doesn't make sense from user point of view. User is just defining search and not saving filter.
3. Plus if I am accessing JIRA as anonymous user, then I also get the same option, which doesn't make sense at all.
4. If user click "Manage Filter", there he gets another link "Create new search". In other way we are just confusing user.

Expected:
1. The name of the links performing same job should be consistent across application.
2. Creating new search look better a option then create filter.
fields.summary: Inconsistent options for creating searches in JIRA

fields.description:
If a system plugin fails to load on startup, it gets persisted in a disabled state.  This means you can then never enable the plugin again since we don't show the link for system plugins.  

We should either show the 'enable' link for system plugins, or never persist them as 'disabled'.

Also for some reason some plugins2 plugins (dashboard) don't show up as system plugins even though they have system="true" set in their plugin descriptors.
fields.summary: System plugins can't ever be enabled again if they fail to load on startup

fields.description:
As per Dylan's comment on the parent issue (JRA-18147), we should provide a checkbox to enable/disable autocomplete on the advanced search screen, which is stored as a user preference.

Also, if JQL autocomplete is disabled at the system level, the user should not expect to be able to use autocomplete even if their preference was already set.
fields.summary: Per-user JQL autocomplete setting

fields.description:
The following is from a chat that I had with a customer:
---
7:51:28 AM]: So, I have a Jira setup
[7:51:30 AM]: 3.13
[7:51:37 AM]: and I couldn't get it to SSL to our SMTP server
[7:51:45 AM]: I used this document from your web site:
[7:51:45 AM]: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/smtpconfig.html
[7:51:51 AM]: it's almost worked
[7:52:34 AM]: I got ths error described in the docs:
[7:52:35 AM]: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/mail/Authenticator
[7:53:03 AM]: your document says that the solution is to remove javamail*.jar and activation*.jar from the WEB-INF/lib directory
[7:53:12 AM]: but I googled around and found this article:
[7:53:20 AM]: http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?threadID=656216
[7:53:50 AM]: I had the exact same problem you describe. Make sure that activation.jar and mail.jar are only in $TOMCAT_HOME/common/lib. The jar files must not be present in the WEB-INF/lib, or things won't work.
[7:53:57 AM]: (that's what it said)
[7:54:00 AM]: and it worked for me
[7:54:14 AM]: I have the Jira standalone version
[7:54:34 AM]: I moved the files from WEB-INF/lib (where your distro places them) into common/lib
[7:54:41 AM]: and it worked great
Kevin Williams [Technical Sales] [7:54:47 AM]: Okay, great, thanks for looking into this!
fields.summary: Customer-suggested improvement to SMTP documenation
JQL documentation is incorrect when describing how the text fields work

fields.description:
It would be cool to have the operations (save, save as, etc) in the advanced navigator view so you do not have to go to the view tab.

We don't include these operation on the simple navigator because we really don't have the screen area available, but on the advanced navigator there is no reason not to show these operations.
fields.summary: It would be cool to have the operations (save, save as, etc) in the advanced navigator view so you do not have to go to the view tab

fields.description:
In IE8 the screen focuses on the left side of the text area.

The header does not render well with my columns, it starts up too wide. As indicated by the previous image, we actually start with a large horizontal scroll bar.

The header does not expand when there are a large number of columns. I know I have been told this is very hard to fix, but it does not look very professional.

The paging navigation links disappear on large screens.

And see the last image, the tabs have no underline.
fields.summary: Navigator does not render correctly under IE8

fields.description: See screenshot. The dashboard names are using the same screen space as the Gadget operators.
fields.summary: Dashboard names obscured by gadgetry

fields.description:
The old colour for viewing issue text was black (000000). The new colour is grey (333333), and much less readable. Is this configurable?

The font for issue summary on view issue page is HUGE! Is this configurable to be smaller, to match the older versions of JIRA?

The font for entering text into description field is now Courier. Yeccch! Can this be changed back to Arial?
fields.summary: Beta 4.0 2 - readibility issues

fields.description:
http://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/UserVotes!default.jspa

{noformat}
HTTP Status 404 - Could not find servlet for: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/UserVotes!default.jspa

type Status report

description The requested resource (Could not find servlet for: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/UserVotes!default.jspa) is not available.
{noformat}
fields.summary: (MyVotes) UserVotes portlet / gadget crashes
Upgrade JIRA to use plugins 2.3.0.rc1

fields.description: Check to see if its possible to allow "jra-1560" without the quotes. At the moment we are parsing it as two tokens "JRA" and "-1560".
fields.summary: Look at JQL Parser and its handling of numbers in relation to issue keys.

fields.description:
Anything typed in the description field when creating an issue on J.A.C doesn't seem to be saved.

I've reproduced this on two bugs using my account now, one in the Confluence project, one in the TST project.  (Will find out shortly if it happens again in the Jira project.)
fields.summary: Issue description is not being saved when issue created.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as vbharara on JAC data.It can be achieve by creating a new tab with a bit long name. Example to just show practical example.
2. Goto dashboard.
3. My first tab on dashboard is named as "Dashboard for Veenu Bharara".
4. By default the first tab is selected.

Result:
1. From UI points it sucks. Specially you can see that there is a cut.
2. I know that we have a tool tip which shows the full text.

Expected:
1. We can show some logical ending for the long text like ... and when user hover on it can see the value.
fields.summary: The handling of long name for tabs for dashboard looks bad

fields.description: We have a little example with 5w, etc in the doco, but we could use to link to how this works or have some examples.
fields.summary: JQL documentation needs more information and examples about the date syntax, including explaining how the 5w works

fields.description: Similar to what gmail provides for email attachments.
fields.summary: Please add the ability to download all attachments on an issue

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Add pie gadget in a screen having resolution 1280*800.
2. Add the same gadget at another JIRA dashboard having resolution 1900 * 1200
3. Open the preferences window.

Result
1. On lower resolution you can clearly see that preferences is not adjusted properly.
2. See screenshot for details
3. Once you set the preferences, the pie chart look ok on both resolutions.

Expected
1. The dialog should adjust according to resolution.
fields.summary: The gadget preference dialog spacing doesn't get adjusted according to the resolution of the computer.

fields.description: We need to document how the IS and IS NOT operators work in JQL.
fields.summary: The JQL documentation does not reference the IS and IS NOT operators and their usage

fields.description:
If you have created the filter and not modified it then the way that you typed it should be preserved.

This is also seen by creating a filter:
type = Bug

Save it, then load it into simple and click view.

It changes to:
type = 1

Not sure when we broke this, lets fix it.
fields.summary: JQL: When creating an search in advanced with the name specified for an issue type, then switch to simple, run the query, switch back the name gets converted to the id

fields.description:
Related to JRA-18209. The "Display Versions" field draws a version line even for Archived Versions.

Given the archived versions basically don't show up anywhere else, they should also be hidden from various graphs that we draw
fields.summary: Show versions in portlets should not show archived versions

fields.description:
Some portlets & gadgets have a feature to show "Major versions" only. At the moment this only excludes . (e.g. 4.0.1 but not 4.0-m1 or 4.0 m1). Is is possible to make this be a bit stricter and treat 4.0-m1 or 4.0 m1 as minor version. Maybe you could make it configurable through some kind of global props.

I would also understand if this gets closed as a won't fix since it's all a bit of hack anyway :)
fields.summary: Major / minor version resolutions should also pick up on - and space
Ability to clone / copy a Gadget

fields.description: Naming a field 'cf[???]' can mean that custom field IDs are not unique within JQL. Fix this.
fields.summary: Naming a field 'cf[???]' can mean that custom field names are not unique.

fields.description:
Typying "-5w" or using "-5weeks" or "-5whatever" does not make any difference in JQL nor in the 'simple' filter.
Only the first letter _w_ is considered.

{noformat}
project = "Confluence" and created >= "-10wiki"
project = "Confluence" and created >= "-10w"
project = "Confluence" and created >= "-10whatever"
{noformat}

Return the same results.
fields.summary: Using the date format strings -5w incorrectly works with -5wiki

fields.description:
Clicking on a saved filter {{CONF issues for SUPPORT}} generates 'HTTP' error. (actually get the HTTP error for all my saved filters or added saved filters when accessing directly from dashboard.)

"4.0-SNAPSHOT-#437"

http://olympia.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa?requestId=16581&mode=hide

{noformat}
HTTP Status 404 - Could not find servlet for: /jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa

type Status report

message Could not find servlet for: /jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa

description The requested resource (Could not find servlet for: /jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/5.5.20
{noformat}
fields.summary: HTTP error when triggering saved filter

fields.description: The auto-help can get annoying especially when you copy and pasting JQL directly from another page.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of auto-completion for jquery

fields.description: Until google-collections 1.0 comes out and fixes [this bug|http://code.google.com/p/google-collections/issues/detail?id=92] we need to load it via the web-app classloader and not as an OSGi bundle. This means that restarting plugins will not leak the OSGi classloaders (although the webapp will not be able to be unloaded).
fields.summary: Add Google Collections to the webapp classpath to workaround FinalizableReferenceQueue memory leak

fields.description:
From the dashboard, click "Add Gadget" to show the directory. All gadgets has a "Gadget URL" link, which, for example in my local development environment, shoud be:
http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets/gadgets/foo-gadget.xml

But it is:
http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets/gadgets/foo-filters-gadget.xml

This affects adding the gadget to a different Atlassian application by adding the gadget's URL to the directory.
fields.summary: Gadget URL published in gadget directory has incorrect path

fields.summary: When trying to release a version with issues remaining and moving the issues to a new version you get an NPE

fields.description:
Every time I click on 'Create Issue' I have to select the project and issue type, as it just defaults to the first in the list. This is really irritating, as I am almost always entering issues against one particular project.

It would be a huge improvement to either:
* Allow me to select my own defaults for the dropdowns
* The dropdowns remember the values I selected the last time
fields.summary: Create Issue drop downs should remember my last choices

fields.description:
I'm looking for a PDF copy of the Greenhopper documentation similar to how the JIRA PDF guides are issued. I need to create an offline copy of the docs.

Please provide.

Thanks,
Rob
fields.summary: Greenhopper Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18197].
  {panel}

This may have already made it into JIRA 4.0, I don't recall.

http://toolsmiths.blogspot.com/2009/07/making-it-easier-to-maintain-jira.html

When there are lots of steps and transitions in a workflow, it would be helpful to see the name of the screen associated with each transition, if it isn't the default. A link to the screen's page would be helpful too. I implemented this for JIRA 3.13 by modifying viewworkflowsteps.jsp
The modified version is at http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/170494153/viewworkflowsteps.jsp
fields.summary: Display the name of the screen used by a transition when viewing the steps

fields.description:
Unlike other flyouts, the Create issue box doesn't close when you hit Esc.

It'd be nice to make the Cancel link a button or something to fit in with the submit button
fields.summary: Create issue pop up should respond to Esc

fields.description:
No idea how I did this but when clicking around the header I managed to get linked to http://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/1.0/menus/browse_link

I can't seem to reproduce it but it might be checking in the code to see if there's any rogue HREFs pointing to it...

or just close it :)
fields.summary: Header somehow got linked off to http://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/1.0/menus/browse_link
Create issue drop down should default to current Project

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Click on "Create Issue" link.
2. Now click on any of tabs drop down link.

Result:
1. The create issue menu is still open.

Expected:
1. Any open dialog or menu options should get close when user open or click at any where
fields.summary: Clicking on JIRA tabs drop down after clicking on "Create issue"  link or vice versa doesn't close the already open menu option

Create thumbnails and screenshots for all gadgets

fields.summary: Issue # graphs have wrong scale sometimes
Select custom fields current do not "fit" the filter form if the value is invalid, when in fact they should

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18177].
  {panel}

The [email integration document|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html#N100DC] explains: 

bq. JIRA examines the email subject and the in-reply-to message for an existing issue reference to determine whether a new issue or comment should be created...

And then, the [FullCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N104CF] and the [NonQuotedCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N105A1] explain:

bq. The issue to use is chosen from the first issue key found in the email subject

And the [CreateOrCommentHandler|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html#N1035E]:

bq. If the subject contains an issue key, the message is added as a comment to that issue. If no issue key is found, a new issue is created in the default project.

All that information is not accurate enough. This is the way it works:

For the FullCommentHandler and the NonQuotedCommentHandler, first we check the mail subject for an issue id. If it is found, we attempt to add a comment to that issue. If no issue id is found in the subject, we check the in-reply-to header on the email, and cross check with all the notifications Jira has sent. If there is a match, we comment on the issue that originated the notification. If not issue is found, the email will not comment any issue.

For the CreateOrCommentHandler, we follow the same process to identify on which issue to comment, but if no issue is found, we create a new one.

It would be good to add this level of detail in the documentation, as we have had several customers confused about this functionality,
fields.summary: Issue/Comment Creation document not detailed enough

fields.description:
I am seeing this exception at the end of the upgrade task

{code}
2009-08-04 11:40:20,696 main ERROR     [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Exception thrown during upgrade: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException
: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteAll (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ID=? (An I/O error occured w
hile sending to the backend.))
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteAll (SQL Exception wh
ile executing the following:DELETE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ID=? (An I/O error occured while sending to the backend.))
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.removeAll(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.removeAllValues(OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.java:200)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.removeAllValues(EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister.java:71)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager.removeCustomFieldPossiblyLeavingOrphanedData(DefaultCustomFieldManager.java:435)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build401.removeCustomFields(UpgradeTask_Build401.java:364)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build401.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build401.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeTaskSucess(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:670)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.runUpgradeTasks(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:567)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgrade(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:401)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeeded(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:351)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeededAndAllowed(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:308)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.checkIfUpgradeNeeded(UpgradeLauncher.java:85)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.contextInitialized(UpgradeLauncher.java:45)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3763)        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4211)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1013)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.start(StandardHost.java:718)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1013)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine.start(StandardEngine.java:442)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.start(StandardService.java:450)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.start(StandardServer.java:709)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:551)        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.start(Bootstrap.java:294)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:432)Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteAll (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM
 public.customfieldvalue WHERE ID=? (An I/O error occured while sending to the backend.))        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.deleteAll(GenericDAO.java:1284)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.removeAll(GenericHelperDAO.java:236)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.removeAll(GenericDelegator.java:1580)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.removeAll(GenericDelegator.java:1523)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.removeAll(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:150)
{code}

It also looks like JIRA does not completely stop itself when a runtime exception is thrown from the upgrade task since the services start running.

In the case of 4.0 the mail service tries to send out subscriptions against saved filters that have not been converted to JQL which is not going to work.
fields.summary: Getting an IO exception from the postgres driver when upgrading JAC data from the ResolutionDate upgrade task

I am using the view filter gadget.

fields.description: Cascading Select searchers are not currently being converted to use the cascadeOption function. When converting, they also need to use the ids of the options instead of the names.

The IssueType context calcuation is not correct.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18172].
  {panel}

In JIRA v 3.13.5- #360 

I was trying to CC Jonathan Nolen on one of the tickets. By mistake I typed his user name into the 'CC Group' text field.
JIRa happily created that group even though it does not exist. I don't believe this is intended behaviour? Is it?

https://support.atlassian.com/secure/admin/user/ViewGroup.jspa?name=jnolen

However,the group picker does not fetch that group??

May one of you look into it please.

Thanks
Ivan

fields.description:
When an admin makes a field hidden or shown in the Field Configuration, then some logic is performed as to whether we need a full re-index in order to pick up the changes and run JQL searches correctly. 

If a use uses the default Field Configuration within a custom Field Configuration Scheme, and no projects use the Default Field Configuration Scheme, then the logic will fail to realise that a re-index is required.
fields.summary: The test for whether an admin needs to re-index on editing Field Configuration can fail when using the default field configuration.

fields.description:
The generated JQL is: resolution = -1
The correct JQL should be: resolution is EMPTY
fields.summary: Statistics mapper generates incorrect JQL clause for search url suffix if resolution is UNRESOLVED

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
Go to the Issue Navigator
Click on "New" Tab
Enter a JQL query which contains a validation error e.g.: "project = XYZ"
Submit the query.
You get redirected to the "Edit" Tab.

When clicking now on the "View" Tab you should stay on the "Edit" Tab according to our Issue Navigator state matrix!
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~trahilly/State+of+the+Navigator+Address

However when submitting another query, which is invalid while on the "Edit" Tab, you will stay on the "Edit" tab.
fields.summary: JQL: Issue Navigator state - inconsistency when moving from "New" Filter Tab to "Edit" Tab with Validation error

fields.description:

description The requested resource (Could not find servlet for: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/IssueNavigator.jspa) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/5.5.26


Also happens when clicking 'In Progress' link.
fields.summary: clicking 'assigned to me' or 'in progress' on issues gadgets causes 404

fields.description:
While writing TestIssueSecurityLevel I found the following problem:

# fred is not a Project Lead
# HSP-3 has Issue Security Level of "Project Lead" only.
# empty JQL (to show all visible issues) doesn't show HSP-3.
# make fred the Project Lead
# same query: still no HSP-3
# however: fred can browse to HSP-3 and view it

The test for this is in TestIssueSecurityLevel but is currently commented out.
fields.summary: JQL not respecting Issue Security Level "Project Lead"

fields.description:
As other products will most probably have a few charting gadgets we should restrict charts that appear in the popup to those that are in both JIRA and Chart directories.
There is some magic that must be done to ensure the charts work.
fields.summary: In order for charts to appear in the charting popup, they should be in both categories JIRA and Charts

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching

When going through the JQL queries, I think we should / have to change the following:

Created Date - The JQL query created = "2008/12/12" doesn't not make much sense since created and updated date timestamps contain also the hour and minute and this query will not return all issues created on this date. Same problem for the updated date query (Updated Date - updated = "2008/12/31"). I suggest to use a range query instead.

The Resolved clause doesn't not exist and should be changed to resolutionDate. Please see also JRA-18081

(note: DueDate is ok as is)
fields.summary: JQL date-related examples should use a range instead of "="

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-18143].
  {panel}

Each version of JIRa has a different built number (by design)

However project restricts itself to data on the exact same build number.

So imagine a XML exported on 3.13.1.  This data cannot be imported into 3.13.4, even though there are no upgrades anc changes to the data logically.

The reason it does this is that it naively assumes that different build numbers means the upgrade tasks need to be run and the configuration of the data needs to be transformed.

The improvement would be for project import to check ask the upgrade system if there are any upgrade tasks and if the answer is 0, then allow the import.

So you would be able to move from 3.13.x to 3.13.x+n but not 4.x for example.  This is a big improvement in my book.
fields.summary: Project import cant bring in data that is logically equaivalent
JIRA Heatmaps e.g. correlating user and component

fields.description:
# Create a custom mutl-select custom field with a project and issues type context.
# Add a new project only context.
# Add options to both contexts.
# Try and set the default in the project, issue type context. Notice there will be a "None" option.
# Try and set the default in the project only context. Notice there is no none option.
fields.summary: Default options for multi-select custom field not consistent in all contexts.

fields.description: When you have a custom field with context 'issuetype = a' and 'project = b' it ends up appearing that the field has the 'Global (All Issues)' context on the view custom field screen. Check out the images.
fields.summary: View Custom Fields incorrectly shows field with 'Global Context'

fields.description:
The Edit tab in the issue navigator is missing when (please follow exactly these steps):
 
- Create a search filter which is invalid for a particular user.
- Login as this user
- Load this Filter via the "Manage Filters" search.
- The validation error appears but the "edit" tab on the top left is missing.
fields.summary: IssueNavigator Edit Tab missing when viewing invalid search filter

fields.description: If you create an invalid search request e.g. {{level = "Level I dont have permission to see"}} the validation will correctly raise an error for the UI. However, the search is still being executed i.e. the query factories are still being invoked to create a lucene query. This seems to be due to code in {{advancedsearch.jsp}} which makes a call to {{getSearchResults()}} on the IssueNavigator.
fields.summary: Invalid search requests still get executed after being deemed invalid

fields.description: Will also need to fix possible a lot of func tests.
fields.summary: rename "edit" issue filter operation link to "Rename"
"Create new from current" link should not be displayed when the loaded filter is invalid
Loaded invalid filters should be directed to the "view" screen where the results are shown but with a warning

fields.description:
Andreas needs to make some improvements to trusted-application behaviour for Gadgets.
In order to do this, we need to first get onto the latest version of Seraph where Trusted Applications is split out into a separate library.

Also, the new version of Seraph uses a [version of oscore library|SER-123] which is more compatible with JIRA's oscore version.
fields.summary: Upgrade to the latest version of Seraph and Trusted Applications library
